title: Permanently Banned for saying "You're full of Gamer Culture"
body: So just this morning at 3 am I ran into some awfully naughty enemies during my early morning game time. They were exuberantly determined to undermine everyone on our team. They were smack talking, being rude, swearing, and calling us names. Now, I'm not the kind of guy that gives a single shit if someone called me a name, or anything. I just move on, or leave a witty comment. WELL, according to riot I am the 0.006 percent of the community that deserves a very nice PERMANENT BAN for saying one single swear word. According to riot, me saying "Fuck off" is the most toxic thing written in all of the summoner's rift. Not, "You fuckin retard, look at your kills gp. LOL, fuckin idiot can't even spell! Drink bleach %%%got" - Enemy team?????? I'm absolutely appalled at the idea that I was targeted by multiple people to get banned. I am the toxic one I guess. To top the entire scenario off, I haven't received any email confirmation from riot, or an answer to my support Ticket. By the way, most of my text contained "Lol, you're full of gamer culture bud"

replies.body: Maybe you should show us your chatlog!
Posted

Permabans are the last step of escalation for consistent or extreme negative behavior, so it takes quite a lot to move yourself up the escalation path and reach one. I recommend posting your chat logs from the Reform Card here so we can go over them with you.
I got banned 1 time before this, no warnings or anything. Also, my chat logs are posted

If you were bumped from zero to 14 day suspension after a few games of joking around with your friends, you must have said some fairly harsh things in those jokes.  What may have seemed harmless to you and your friend, doesn't always look that way to the other people on your team, or the people on the other team.  It can look like extremely rude, offensive or mean behavior.  

Unfortunately, since you were given a 14 day suspension, it does not take much to be permabanned from that point.  A valid report for a minor infraction of the Code of Conduct can be enough to trigger the ban once you have reached the fourth punishment tier.  And from looking at your logs, there are a couple things that would have been enough to do so.  

> hobocall: like fuck off

Telling your teammates/opponents to fuck off is pretty rude, but most people overlook it if it's said to an enemy who is camping their lane.  They don't tend to overlook it when it's said to a teammate though.  And it sounds like it was said to a teammate who forgot smite and was trying to duo lane with you for a little while.  Which looks like it led to the next few lines of your logs.

> hobocall: everygame its always 3 trash people ganking me
> hobocall: stop talking idiot
> hobocall: jesus you guys are so brain dead
> hobocall: i forgot everyone online has the iq of a toddler

These things are generally not overlooked.  Nobody likes to be called trash, in fact almost everyone finds it either a) insulting, b) an incentive to 3 man gank you repeatedly to keep pissing you off, or c) both a) and b) are correct.  And calling people idiots, brain dead, or saying they have the IQ of a toddler is definitely insulting.  It's all considered verbal abuse, and any of it is enough to garner the valid report that would trigger your permaban.  

That's the bad news.  The good news is that you are able to make another account if you wish to do so.  And now you will know what not to say in the future.

These are likely the reasons for your ban.  "Full of gamer culture" isn't offensive by any means, however you're consistently flaming and badgering your teammates for mistakes as well as egging the enemy team on.  You also seem to have an issue with /all chat, so I'd recommend either turning it off or learning better coping methods of dealing with people that antagonize you.  Calling everyone brain dead and having the Intelligence Quotient of a toddler isn't friendly material, and demoralizes the morale of a team.  It honestly looks like you're just wanting someone to argue with and/or blame someone else for your own mistakes when things go south, as you're very quick to point the finger at others.  It's a TEAM game, after all, and being part of a TEAM is important.  A little bit of introspection is fine by checking your replays and learning what YOU could have done better, but flaming your teammates is only opening up a can of worms that won't end well.

Also, side note:  If you flame and call out an entire group of people (yourself included) by "everyone online" expect to be reported as you're no longer directing your anger in any productive method, you're harassing a population.

Again, turn of /all chat if you have an issue with it, and don't flame your teammates.  The Mute button works wonders, and I would highly recommend you use that on your next account.  You've been banned before, so you're a frequent offender in the system.  You're also still flaming those people publicly here on the forums while trying to garner sympathy, I'm honestly not sure what you expect.  Perhaps one of them actually has a learning disability, how do you think that makes them feel?  There's no need to be toxic and flame teammates, and antagonizing the enemy team is only asking for a bad time as they immediately know you're prone to tilting and will, more or less, ensure it happens.

A little friendly banter is fine, and will show you a person's true character and how they handle situations.  If you fail a tower dive and /all chat "BEST DIVE NA" then everyone will likely laugh it off and move on, however if you fail the tower dive and start flaming it's a quick decision for the enemy of "Let's camp this guy, he's tilted and over-aggressive and will give us free kills."

Read my previous post, I did quote it specifically for you.  You're not flaming us on the forums, you're specifically calling the enemy team "stupid" here on the forums even after you've been banned for toxicity for flaming.  It matters not how others act - you cannot change them - the only person you can change is yourself.  Make a world that you want to live in, not the one you hope for it to be.

And not to sound condescending, but $50 USD isn't an incredibly large amount for a game.  Hell most AAA games go for $60+ not including DLC's and addons and will absolutely ban you outright forcing you to purchase them again if you wish to continue - this becomes a heavy money-sink if you're frequently banned from such activities.

Perhaps now you don't see the ban being warranted or your own toxicity, but hopefully in the future you will - and will reform to become an honorable summoner that the community will appreciate playing with.  Yes, a permanent ban is a serious penalty and is usually reserved for the extreme players (such as Tyler1) who show a repeat pattern of offense.  You're always welcome to message Riot Support about the reasons for your punishment, but at the end of the day it's usually (barring false-positives, having your account compromised, etc.) your own actions that brought you there - much like the judicial system in our regular world.

And again, for future accounts, utilize the Mute feature and/or turn off /all chat if you're unable to hold yourself back from being toxic to those that flame you.  Report them after the game and move on with your life, there's nothing more you can do.

Ah and here we have the true nature of why you were banned coming out.  Thanks for posting this!  It definitely helps to reassure the community that your ban was indeed deserving.  Best of luck to you in the future.
